result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy L. Bundy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 05-21-2015. Complete all hours by 09-01-2015 with minimum of 10 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:  Revoke stay of jail.

15 days in the Pepin County Jail and stayed on the following condition:
Pay restitution in the amount of $340.35 to Pepin County District Attorney at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 05-01-2015 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Consequences for failure to pay:  Revoke stay of jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy L. Bundy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Community Service Completion Report.
Obligations of community service completed as of 10/1/15 as verified by C/S Coordinator.

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 40 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 05-21-2015. Complete all hours by 09-01-2015 with minimum of 10 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:

Judge advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty on count 1.  Court reviews PLQ/WOR form. Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Sentence to 15 days in PCJ & stay it on following conditions:  Pay restitution of $340.35 to Pepin Co. DA at $100/mo. with 1st pymt. due 5/1 and each mo. thereafter until paid in full.  Perform 40 hrs. community service.  Waive costs.  Count 2 DRI.  Advised of appeal rights.
Defendant Stacy L. Bundy in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Charles Bachman in court.  Ms. Bundy unable to appear rdue to health problems, request to adjourn to 4/21.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy L. Bundy in court with SPD attorney, John Bachman.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $500 Sign. Bond.  No objection by Atty Bachman.  Court sets $500 Sign. Bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
